page.title: 14Linlithgow Fire Station
page.content: At Linlithgow Fire Station ten men, including one sub-officer and one leading fireman,are employed on a part time basis for which they are paid an annual sum of money.The station has one water tender-ladder-fire appliance which carries four hundred gallons of water. As they are part-time,the firemen have pocket bleepers through which they can be contacted when they are required. On average they fight about one hundred fires per year.Most fires in the home are caused by chip-pans or chimney fires.Many fires are caused by carelessness.e.g. faulty electrical appliances or carelessly discarded smoking materials. Some of the most dangerous fires are those ininvolving chemicals or gas, when firemen use foam or dry powder.
